title: NFDI-MatWerk/IUC02 Data schema for creep data of Ni-base superalloys including a comprehensive documentation of test results and metadata
description: JSON Schema for the NFDI-MatWerk IUC02. (DOI: 10.5281/zenodo.11668375)

testStandardApplied.description: Was the test performed according to a test standard?

enum: Uninterrupted creep tests with continuous monitoring of extension
Interrupted creep tests with periodic measurement of elongation
Stress rupture tests where normally only the time to fracture is measured

endOfTest.description: Describe the end of test if none of the preset criteria (time or extension limit) could be met.

relatedArticle.description: Multiple input entries for instance for MSE research article DOI, Zenodo DOI, FDO.

possiblePhaseTransformation.description: Is any phase transformation expected due to temperature during the creep test? - Please provide any supporting material, if possible. Answers could be, e.g., a link to a TTT-curve or a DOI of an article.

geometrySizeAsManufacturedMaterial.description: Please provide a description or/and any supporting material, e.g., link to image or technical drawing, if possible.

manufacturingProcessDescriptionAsManufac.description: E.g., Cast/Melting, Casting, and Remelting/Induction melting in air, Casting into a circular ingot and then electroslag remelting.

geometrySizeAsTestedMaterial.description: The test piece is manufactured from the as-tested material. Please add a description or a link to Image or technical drawing. The as-tested material is the material to be tested. The as-tested material can be a component.

heatTreatmentProtocol.description: Link to file, preferably with machine-readable (meta)data.

characterizationMethod.description: E.g., STEM, HRTEM, TEM-EDX, AFM, SEM, SEM-EBSD, ….

measuredCondition.description: E.g., as-manufactured, heat-treated, before testing, after testing.

measuringPosition.description: Specify position(s) for bulk (middle/top/bottom/surface) and/or microstructure feature (matrix, interdendtitic region, phase,...)

microstructureImage.description: Link to file, e.g., an optical micrograph, preferably with machine-readable (meta)data.

microstructureReport.description: Link to file, preferably with machine-readable (meta)data.

microstructureNi-BasedSX.description: The following fields apply to the considered example of single crystal Ni-Based Superalloys.

grainSizeDistribution.description: Link to file, preferably with machine-readable (meta)data.

grainAdditionalInformation.description: Include all further relevant characterization results.

reprecipitatedGammaGammaPrimeRegions.description: Completely dissolved and re-precipitated gamma-gamma' regions.

dendriteSpacings.description: Please describe the procedure and add a link to file, preferably with machine-readable (meta)data or add a reference to paper and section.

proofOfSingleCrystallinity.description: Link to file, preferably with machine-readable (meta)data.

singleCrystalOrientation.description: Link to file, preferably with machine-readable (meta)data. Laue Crystal Verification. Must be documented for each test piece.

measuringPosition.description: Specify position(s) for bulk (middle/top/bottom/surface) and/or microstructure feature (matrix, interdendtitic region, phase,...)

allOf.description: Link to file, preferably with machine-readable (meta)data or add the wt.-% value for each element
Include precision, if available. Link to file, preferably with machine-readable (meta)data or add the wt.-% value for each element

measurementMethod.description: Provide a description of the used method(s) and details about measurement volume/points.

crackOrDefectInspectionMethod.description: E.g., Penetrant certification/Radiographic certification/XCT/X-Ray film. Link to file, preferably with machine-readable (meta)data.

proofStrengthCreepTestTemperature.description: 0.2 % Proof strength at creep test temperature.

testPieceHistory.description: Link to file, preferably with machine-readable (meta)data. The file(s) can include, e.g., data or documentation from previous experiments.

testPieceTechnicalDrawing.description: Link to file, preferably with machine-readable (meta)data.

testPieceOriginAndOrientation.description: Describe the exact location/positioning of the test piece within the as-tested material. E.g., Do rolling direction and the longitudinal axis coincide? Is the test piece located on top or bottom? Do coordinate systems of as-tested material and test piece coincide? Add a link to a file, e.g., a technical drawing showing this, preferably with machine-readable (meta)data.

testPieceOrientationInTestMachine.description: Describe the exact orientation of the test piece within the test machine. E.g., is the longitudinal axis of the test piece exactly parallel to the loading axis of the test machine? Add a link to a file providing evidence, preferably with machine-readable (meta)data. This can be, e.g., a technical drawing.

additionalInformationTestPiece.description: Add the information or a link to file, preferably with machine-readable (meta)data, e.g., Roughness.

testFrameAndSpecimenAlignment.description: Verification of Test Frame and Specimen Alignment according to ASTM E1012?

testFrameAndSpecimenAlignmentDescription.description: Please provide a description on the procedure followed for the Verification of Test Frame and Specimen Alignment if different from ASTM E1012.

calibrationClass.description: Calibration class of test frame and specimen alignment, e.g., 5 / 5 starting from 3 kN (according to ASTM E1012).

calibrationCertificate.description: Link to file, preferably with machine-readable (meta)data. Please specify which device/feature/part of the test machine was calibrated.

useOfCalibratedWeights.description: Were calibrated weights used to apply the test force?

descriptionOfTheLoadingSystem.description: Please describe the loading system and related verification in the case that calibrated weights were not used.

dataAcquisitionTimeCheck.description: Was the time checked during data acquisition?

loadSensorDuringLoading.description: Was a load sensor used during loading?

forceRecording.description: Was the force recorded continuously or periodically (e.g., during loading)?

roomTemperature.description: Was the room temperature recorded and checked?

roomHumidity.description: Was the room humidity recorded and checked?

temperatureSignal.description: Which temperature signal was used for temperature control?

metrologicalTraceability.description: Yes, if temperature sensor AND data acquisition are calibrated.

thermocoupleType.description: Following fields until /Thermocouple location/ refer exemplarily to a Thermocouple sensor type.

calibrationCertificate.description: Link to File, preferably with machine-readable (meta)data.

thermocoupleLocation.description: Location with respect to gauge section

calibrationStatus.description: Is/are the data acquisition unit calibrated?

calibrationCertificate.description: Link to File, preferably with machine-readable (meta)data.

contactingExtensometer.description: Following fields until /Calibration standard/ refer exemplarily to a contacting measuring method/device.

extensionAveraging.description: Was there an averaging of the extension values? (two-sided extensometer)

enum: At test piece in parallel length

extensometerID.description: The ID used for identification in the laboratory.

extensometerLegMaterial.description: Material of upper/lower legs, e.g., in LVDT systems.

calibrationStatus.description: Is extensometer incl. the data acquisition calibrated?

equipmentID.description: The ID used for identification in the laboratory.

primaryDataSeries.description: Primary data is data that is directly acquired by sensors or measuring instruments during or after a test. Please add a list of the measured quantities and their corresponding units.

processedDataSeries.description: Processed data is obtained as a result of using procedures (equations, algorithms, methods, unit conversions) to transform primary data. Please describe the transformed quantities, their corresponding units, and the applied procedures.

dataAnalysisProcedures.description: Description of the data processing and analysis procedures used to obtain specific test results, e.g. percentage elastic extension, $e_{e}$.

software.description: If applicable, please list the used software, including product and version.

relatedPublications.description: If applicable, please list publications related to the data analysis procedure/software used.

determinationOfReferenceLength.description: Case 1: Reference length for calculation of percentage extensions/elongations if the original gauge length Lo and/or extensometer Le are inside the parallel length, Lc. In this case Lr = Le (percentage extensions) or Lr = Lo (percentage elongations). Case 2: Reference length for calculation of percentage extensions/elongations if the original gauge length Lo and/or extensometer Le are outside the parallel length, Lc. In this case, Lr, for calculation of percentage is corrected to consider the strain contributions of the shoulders/ridges.

elapsedTimeFromEndOfLoading.description: Link to file, preferably with machine-readable (meta)data. Symbol usually indicated as t.

extension.description: Link to file, preferably with machine-readable (meta)data. Symbol usually indicated as delta $L_{et}$.

elongation.description: Link to file, preferably with machine-readable (meta)data. Symbol usually indicated as delta $L_{ot}$.

enum: Within the gauge length and the parallel length
At the edge of the upper extensometer gauge length
At the edge of the lower extensometer gauge length
At the edge of the upper parallel length
At the edge of the lower parallel length
Outside the extensometer the extensometer gauge length and the parallel length

correctedMeasuredTemperature.description: Link to file, preferably with machine-readable (meta)data. Symbol usually indicated as $T_{c})$.

percentageExtension.description: Link to file, preferably with machine-readable (meta)data. Data series corresponds to the percentage plastic extension from end of loading. If the  percentage initial plastic extension is not zero, these data series coresponds to the percentage creep extension from end of loading. Symbol usually indicated as e.
